program_title: Biorefinery, Renewable Chemical, and Biobased Product Manufacturing Assistance Program
program_description_short: The Biorefinery, Renewable Chemical, and Biobased Product Manufacturing Assistance Program – also known as the “Section 9003 Program” – provides loan guarantees to eligible applicants to develop advanced biofuels, renewable chemicals, and biobased-products manufacturing facilities to deliver new and innovative technologies.
overview_purpose: develop, build, or retrofit facilities to support new and emerging technologies, and produce advanced biofuels, renewable chemicals, and biobased products
overview_maximum_federal_participation_d: percent of all eligible project costs
overview_borrower_equity_contribution: The borrower and other involved principals must make a significant cash equity contribution investment.
eligible_borrowers: individuals, corporations, and cooperatives with eligible lenders
eligible_lenders_example_3: Farm credit institutions with direct lending authority
eligible_lenders_example_4: Credit Unions examined or supervised by a state agency or the National Credit Union Administration
eligible_lenders_example_5: The National Rural Utilities Cooperative Finance Corporation
lender_eligibility_description: An eligible lender is any federal or state-chartered bank, Farm Credit Bank, other Farm Credit System institution with direct lending authority, or bank that serves cooperatives.
lender_fdic_requirement: The lender must demonstrate it meets Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation (FDIC) definition of “well capitalized”
lender_fdic_definition_timing: at the time of application and issuance of the Loan Note Guarantee
governing_regulation_1_title: Code of Federal Regulation 7 CFR 4279, Subpart C
questions_email_subject_line_instruction: Be sure to mention the Section 9003 program in your subject line.
